availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, carpenter. Massachusetts native. Married to Mary "Polly" Ray Newton. Father of Andrew J. Newton, Silas L. Newson, James R. Newton, Marcellus Newton, Francis Newton, John D. Newton, Hiram Newton, and Mary Newton. Married to Caroline Gilmore Newton in Warren County, Kentucky, on December 3, 1854. Father of George Newton. Carpenter in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1850. Carpenter in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, pp. 71B-72A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 1.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994057, Warren County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000164005.
"Hiram Newton (1800-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial 101025874, accessed July 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/101025874.
